website_summaries.verdict: Uses pulse oximetry to give you extra peace of mind that your baby is safe and sound – but no video component.
pros: Monitors your infant's oxygen levels and heart rate
Alerts you via app, sound, and light should it detect an issue
Sock fits babies up to 18 months or 25 lbs
cons: Does not show you a video of your baby

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like this product
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this product. It gave me relief and piece of mind for the first few weeks we used it with our newborn. However, after two weeks we noticed a major red marking on his foot where we put the sock. It looks like a ton of blood vessels have burst in his foot and the Owlet product is definitely to blame. We had to immediately stop using the product to avoid harming our baby. Buyer beware of this possible reaction when using this product on your baby. So disappointed to have to return this.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: I feel like for the price of the item all services should ...
customer_reviews.text: Im only giving 4 stars because you have to pay to get the additional services on their Conected Care app. I feel like for the price of the item all services should be included. However, I do sleep much better knowing my little one is being monitored. He has a heart condition so I keep it on him most of the time during the day too for my own peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost!
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny for peace of mind, especially during the high SIDs risk age range. Easy to pair to your phone for monitoring but you don't need to for it to work. The base will alarm with a noise and color if oxygen or heart rate levels drop. Comes with multiple size booties to fit a growing baby.
customer_reviews.author: amazongirl

customer_reviews.title: I love this product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! Had a little trouble the first 2 days because of our internet connection, the sock still worked we just couldn't see the babys levels. Once the connection was fixed we haven't had any problems or false alarms. I sleep so much better knowing my child is monitored and will be alarmed if something is wrong. The only thing that need to be adjusted is the rates for what is normal. An oxygen level in the 80's is not normal and 60 is super low for a child's heart rate. I wish I was able to adjust it myself. Hopefully in the future it will be adjusted to the correct normal limits.
customer_reviews.author: Rebeca

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. Wont work after 24hr server outage
customer_reviews.text: This sock was difficult to register in the first place but we made it work eventually. It worked fine for a few days and then owlet had a server outage that lasted over 24 hours. Since the outage, the base station would not connect to our phones. We've reset it multiple times and now it won't re register. It doesn't work at all. We're done with this product and done trying to make it work. Returned
customer_reviews.author: morgan Vandee

customer_reviews.title: Owlets are burning babys feet!
customer_reviews.text: It's leaving Burn marks on the bottom of babys foot! I will be getting documentation from her doctor, and will make it my personal mission that every parent considering buying an Owlet knows that it leaves burn marks on your babys foot!
customer_reviews.author: Chastity Hawes

customer_reviews.title: Four months into its use...battery is dead.
customer_reviews.text: Bought June 15th, 2018...started using as directed about a week later. Now last night October 9th, the alarm went off for low battery at about 5 hours into use... Left it charging all day and today June 10th in the evening, just as I disconnected it to put it on my 4 month old baby...the alarm went off for low battery... amazing that a $299 item is useless with so little use.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE ours! After bringing our son home from a one week stay in the NICU for TTN (breathing) issues, I was a nervous wreck. I immediately ordered an Owlet and have been grateful for it ever since. With my first two children, I would wake in the night just to check they they were breathing (sometimes accidentally waking them while checking!) and with our third, we used the AngelCare under mattress monitor. But the Owlet is the best. It’s always on him, no matter where he naps (in this newborn phase), the app is super easy to use and it gives me peace of mind while he sleeps. It’s well worth the money, just for that.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Burn mark on foot
customer_reviews.text: The sock sensor light left a burn mark on my baby’s left foot. I would not use this or recommend it to anyone. May be coincidence, but the night we found the burn we obviously did not use the owlet sock and baby slept through the night. I worry that the sock was burning her and keeping her from a good night sleep :(
customer_reviews.author: Dillon Watt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect piece of mind
customer_reviews.text: I was super nervous purchasing these because of so many reviews saying they’ve had tons of false alarms but in the few weeks we have been using them, we haven’t had a single one. Having these on our babies has been the best way to get a little extra sleep through all the strange newborn noises. I only gave this 4 stars however because the newborn sock is too big for babies under 5.5 lbs and the app is not multiple friendly. We had preemies and couldn’t monitor them for several weeks because the socks were too big and kept saying they were wiggling.
customer_reviews.author: Nagnot

customer_reviews.title: Sock broke around month 4, whole unit around month 10
customer_reviews.text: The sock died around baby's month 4, and the company was actually able to replace it, which was great. Now around month 10, the unit is no longer able to connect to the WiFi, making it functionally useless. Add to this, problems logging in using the "old app" and having to create an account on the "new app," which again is a useless effort when the unit itself won't connect to Wifi. Good luck reaching tech support. Despite hours posted on their website, "Available Everyday 6am - 11pm MST", the recording you get at 10:30pm MST tells you they are only open to 9:00pm MST. WTF?
customer_reviews.author: jmh

customer_reviews.title: Significant Privacy Concerns
customer_reviews.text: I cannot recommend this product until the company addresses the significant privacy concerns implicated by the app required to setup this device. Why does the app require a parent to submit her name and date of birth to setup the app? How is that information used and why is it required? How does that information help the app monitor a baby? Perhaps the company could provide an explanation?
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Infuriating, terrifying, useless and dangerous
customer_reviews.text: If you want your precious sleep hours disrupted with multiple false alarms arriving up to thirty-forty minutes late between yours and your spouse's phones, and induced fatigue along with heightened anxiety, this product is for you; otherwise, stay away and just follow the guidelines of AAP.
customer_reviews.author: J Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: For the money you spend on this you would think it would work correctly. It constantly beeps in the middle of the night saying it’s lost connection, and yes I followed all the procedures by the book, even disconnected and reconnected the sock. More trouble then it’s worth, every time the alarm goes off your heart drops thinking something has gone wrong with your baby but in all actuality it’s the sock that is wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Peter’s wife

customer_reviews.title: Piece of mind?  More like pain in the ***!
customer_reviews.text: Unit complained that it is too far away from the base station. Huh? The base station connects to the wifi, I can only assume so the monitor can move around the house, no? I have a high quality mesh wifi system, so whats the deal there? When its not complaining about that, the unit just flat out stops communicating with the base station for no apparent reason, nearly hourly, giving you panic attacks on your phone. First time parent after 3 years of trying, 9 miscarriages, needless to say I wanted this baby to live and the countless errant messages were more of a pain in the you-know-what than it was comforting. Returned. Especially at this price point- Garbage!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: The app hasn’t worked for at least 5 days
customer_reviews.text: We have had the owlet for 5 nights and the app has been down every day. That means we cannot get readings of the heart rate or oxygen levels. We have contacted support and they said the base station will alert us if there is a problem by flashing red. But the base station cannot tell whether it is the heart rate or oxygen level that is the problem. It does not show the levels. It also sends an alert if it can’t connect. My arm/hand on the baby’s foot while nursing blocked the signal and set off the alarm waking my husband.
customer_reviews.author: M. R

customer_reviews.title: No issues, does as it says
customer_reviews.text: So far no real issues. Sock doesn’t seem to bother my baby. I at first didn’t know if he could wear a sleeper over it but after some research it seems okay and that’s what we’ve been doing. Sock stays in place, no issues connecting to the base. To cut the sock off seems easy enough via instructions but it takes me several tries and usually removing the device from the sock to do so. I get two nights out of one charge but my son is only wearing it around 7 hours a night. No marks on babies foot, btw you should alternate feet every other night. I’m pretty happy with this device!
customer_reviews.author: Carla Sprenger

customer_reviews.title: What a bummer
customer_reviews.text: 3 false alarms in 1 night Things they don't tell you - if your baby moves, it doesn't read - if your baby budges it off, it will alarm -i live in 900 sq feet and it constantly lost signal
customer_reviews.author: Kaylin KeyrouseTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Changes needed
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning this. I want to be able to silence alerts. Not have it constantly buzz like an alarm clock for 79% O2. I love the concept but want it to be perfected a bit more. I can see where parents of NICU babies and other LDS with knows issues could benefit and find the constant alerts helpful, but I didn’t need it for my full term no known problems baby anymore.FYI we initially bought to relieve anxiety- so we could trust phone to wake us up instead of staring at baby awake all night.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Expected piece of mind, got a piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this is a truly disappointing product. 2.5 months after buying it and it stopped working! The set up instructions are difficult, the customer support people are wrong half the time. I had to call back 3 times and install 2 different versions of the app before it would work the first time. By the time I got used to using it, it broke. I have been waiting over a week for the replacement that should have arrived in “3-5 business days.” I wouldn’t waste your money. This product should give you piece of mind but all it has given me is a headache.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: 4 out of 5
customer_reviews.text: Likes -Helps us actually sleep at night -Pretty accurate reading -Alerts you very well especially if sock falls off(never has happened just tested) -placement is pretty simple Dislikes -The sock will say wrong placement if it gets too hot from a blanket -Occasionally says bad foot placement -It could have a better charging system but oh well -Shouldn’t be so expensive
customer_reviews.author: Trevor K

customer_reviews.title: NOT COMPATIBLE WITH COMCAST
customer_reviews.text: This product is a joke. It came highly recommended from a few fellow mama friends of mine. i splurged, shining I would finally get some nighttime relief, only to find out this product is not compatible with comcast. I have been on the phone with owlet for over 4 weeks. They have had me download THREE different apps. NONE of them worked. I even went through comcast, sat on the phone with them for hours, only to conclude/confirm that it was no compatible with comcast. I even switched out my modem at the request of owlet, and nothing. This device has been nothing but a PITA. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish i had this with my first child!
customer_reviews.text: Both my babies are NICU warriors. we invested in the owlet for our second baby. She was born with immature lungs and stayed in the NICU for 3 weeks. The owlet gave us peace of mind that she would be ok during the night. We havnt had any red alarms and hope we never do. We have had a few yellow alarms from her kicking the sock off a tad. I love that owlet works on and off a wifi signal as we travel alot. Over all great product. I wish we invested in this product sooner with our first
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working out of warranty
customer_reviews.text: I loved the piece of mind with this product having a premie. The app connectivity was always bad though. After I used it for about 8 months, it was put away for a few months. Then I went to use it on a foster baby and within a couple weeks of reuse the sock developed a hole where the charging port is. Shortly thereafter it stopped holding a charge all together. Owlet told me I was out of luck because I purchased it 13 months prior and therefore it was beyond the one year warranty. This product is too expensive to stop working after less than 9 months of use. Obviously, I'm also very dissatisfied with the customer service.
customer_reviews.author: G-Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Peace of Mind!
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is great. I love that I can go on my phone, see exactly what my little son's readings are, and go right to sleep without worrying. We have had one false alarm, but it was due to the sock slipping, and we sleep with the bassinet right in front of our faces so we can jump into action if need be. We had debated about getting this monitor because it is so expensive, but it is 100% worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product needs to have adj parameters
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product in the sense of being able to check your child. You know for breathing. Lol! All jokes to the side it has given my wife and I peace of mind at night. The down side it’s just like a sport watch. It will give you a range of heart rate and oxygen. It’s not a medical device. The worst thing about this is the parameters that are preset. The low heart rate and oxygen is to low for a baby. It needs to be adjustable. I would have preferred to had the low parameters higher for my infant. Bottom line for peace of mind at night it’s a wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Beebe

customer_reviews.title: Depends what you want it for.
customer_reviews.text: Our twins spent 90 days in the NICU and we bought two of these for when we brought them home. Pros- - We compared them to the hospital machines and found them to be quite accurate. - Nice battery life and fast charging. - Easy set-up - App includes a twin feature for two devices. Cons - - Does not work away from the base. We thought with the WiFi app we would be able to use while out, like in the car, but this is not the case. - The base is not chargeable or portable. - Will not register if the baby is in a swing or rock & play. It just says the baby is wiggling.
customer_reviews.author: MaryEvette

customer_reviews.title: Terrible reliability
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my second child, I was hoping to get more piece of mind when putting him in his crib or swing. Unfortunately I have had nothing but issues with this. It is constantly alarming by not getting readings. I have tried all of the sock sizes, tightening it, and moving the sock around. I just could not get this consistent for more than a few hours. it could just be that my son squirms around too much for this to be reliable, but I am not happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: Only cute to look at- not use
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my twins, who were full-term births. The sock does not fit either of them, and sent off a crazy alarm every 3 to 5 minutes. After about 20 minutes of getting out of bed to go turn that off, I finally just took them off of the babies. I read other reviews were the sock alerts too often, and I definitely can agree with that. I was really bummed out because of the amount of money that I spent as a single mother to buy two of these just to have them not work and I’ve already thrown the box away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Is it accurate? Read review
customer_reviews.text: It gives me a peace of mind and helps me sleep better BUT. I wrapped it around my two fingers so I wouldn’t forget to take it into my room and plug it in.. and it read that my heartbeat was 136 and oxygen was 97%..... I put on a medical grade pulse ox at the same time and my heart rate was 76 and oxygen 94%... this makes me extremely worried if the results for baby are inaccurate. If it can come up with a made up reading off my two fingers..... it should have said unable to read.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah C

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t fit newborn
customer_reviews.text: We were very excited to use this product on our newborn. Unfortunately it kept slipping and the alarm would go off. When we called customer service they told us to wait until her foot was bigger...and that it was only meant for when the baby was not moving...That did not sit well with us because we spent a lot of money to keep our newborn safe. So, keep in mind if you want this for your newborn and they are smaller than average it may not fit. We returned immediately and bought the Snuza Hero which we really like.
customer_reviews.author: aimee clarke

customer_reviews.title: Product works well but is not for me
customer_reviews.text: My experience with this sock Wasn’t bad, the product works as expected it monitors baby and help first time parents to sleep a little bit at night not wondering or scared. How ever the batterie life is sooo short it is annoying. I had to charged the sock daily for at least 4-5 hours. If only lasted a Few days I wouldn’t mind but with everything a new mom has on her plate charging the sock is the least someone remembers and then the batterie dies and you keep your baby unmonitored.
customer_reviews.author: AngieBM

customer_reviews.title: Allows us to get some sleep
customer_reviews.text: The Owlet has its issues and frankly is behind the times of what is possible with technology. The main shortfall of this product is it does not work when the baby is moving which would include in a baby swing. The app will just say the baby is wiggling and will not tell you the heart rate of O2. The app is also slow to launch and respond. With its two main shortfalls in mind this is a must have for new parents. It gives us piece at mind and allows us to get some real sleep knowing our baby is just fine (at least when the baby is sleeping).
customer_reviews.author: JardSquid

customer_reviews.title: MUST BUY
customer_reviews.text: I can not stress enough for every mom to buy one of these. It saved our sons life. (2 months old) One evening, during his sleep his oxygen and heart rate dropped. He wasn't but two feet away from me while I was working on a diaper cake for my sister-in-law's baby shower. He was so peaceful. The only reason it was not SIDS, is because he didn't die, the owlet monitor alarmed me immediately, giving me enough time to take action to save him. It landed us a hospital stay. I beg, beg, beg mothers to buy this. $300 is nothing compared to their priceless life.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and can't be configured to be useful
customer_reviews.text: Writing with my daughter sleeping on my chest because their multi-hour outage makes this monitor a useless POS. Even when it's working, you can't configured your own thresholds. I had a doctor laugh at their alarm threshold today, 80% O2 is a very bad level to get an alarm. Most parents want to set it closer to 90 to be able to intervene if there's a problem. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Baby was in NICU for a week post aspiration. I was worried about bringing him home unmonitored. 2 months later and I am still using this. My husband and I discuss the readings every morning over coffee. I sleep well knowing I will be alerted if there is a problem. Easy to use. It stays on his foot and doesn't seem to bother him. We put it on the charger every morning. I think mothers without high risk newborns will love this. Our baby has never slept in our room. He is always in his crib with the monitor. We also use a video and audio monitor to see him and hear his cries.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Hovey

customer_reviews.title: Great idea. Has issues.
customer_reviews.text: The idea is great. I so wanted this to work. I have bad anxiety that somethings gonna happen to my baby boy and i wont know. Weve tried for almost 8 years to have a baby and finally was blessed. I got this to help with my anxiety, and all it did was make it worse and give me panic attacks because it constantly went off every 10 minutes saying it needed to be readjusted. Even though the sock was in perfect placement and he never moved it. It kept me from sleeping and him as well. Its so stressful. I sleep more without it than with it. I love the idea, wish it worked for me.
customer_reviews.author: ChaoticBoo

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: This provides so much peace of mind for new parents. We didn’t have it for our first son and got it for our second and love it so much. I had an issue with the sensor charging and called customer service and they replaced it for free. Another time I had an issue connecting to the app and called and they helped me resolve it immediately. I will be singing their praises for years to come!
customer_reviews.author: JB1214

customer_reviews.title: Great for FTM peace of mind!
customer_reviews.text: I’m so happy we bought this owlet sock. My husband was skeptical and said we didn’t need it and now he says it’s been a lot more helpful than he thought it would be. As first time parents we didn’t know what the heck we were doing and worried constantly (still do!). This helped us feel better while we slept. Don’t get me wrong, it’s not a babysitter and obviously you still need to follow all recommended safe sleeping practices - but it eases the mind just a bit. I didn’t realize all the sounds that newborns make so when I hear something funny I check the app for his oxygen level and it helps me feel okay about it!
customer_reviews.author: JLB

customer_reviews.title: FIX YOUR APP
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sock in a moment of anxiety and sleep deprivation. I loved it at first. I was actually able to sleep without panicking that something was wrong. It worked great for two weeks and the app just stopped. Every night multiple times a night I have to reset the entire base station to get it to show live readings on my phone. So here I am at four am doing just that. For $300 this should work flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Best investment I could have ever made. I was told shortly before my son was released from the NICU about the Owlet sock and when looking into it I was a little nervous on purchasing because of the bad reviews on false alarms, WiFi connection issues, bad customer service and so on. But I am so glad I did. I have had none of those issues and it’s been such a peace of mind for me now that I have my son home.
customer_reviews.author: Sally P

customer_reviews.title: Battery life does not last the entire night after one month of use!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item before my son was born..... I started using it when he was 2 months old. He is now 3.5 months old now. The item definitely gives me a piece of mind at night. I do love it for that Cons: the sock battery life after using it every night for 1.5 months doesn’t even last all night anymore. I’ve had this item for too long to return it but I wish this wasn’t an issue...... for the amount of money I’ve spent on this the battery life should be lasting at least the entire night like it used to for one month..... so I would recommend this product if owlet fixes this glitchy battery issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WORTH IT.
customer_reviews.text: Im a FTM and this saved my sanity those first few months even though he was sleeping in his bassinet right next to the bed. When you come home with your first new born you immediately enter the world of sleep deprivation from worrying and constantly providing. The owlet was like a little nurse in the room telling me and my husband that it was ok to get some sleep, she’d (owlet) wake us if anything happened. And believe me, that alarm that goes off on the base and your phone is LOUD even if your phone is on silent! Thankfully our baby was ok, I just didn’t put the sock on properly bc I was delirious lol
customer_reviews.author: adam ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Owlet Baby Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as a gift for Grand-Son and his wife. They just had their second child and she was spitting-up during night and choking on it. The parents were not able to sleep for the worry of the baby choking too much. The baby monitor didn't stop the spitting-up, but it does allow the parents to go to sleep knowing the monitor will wake them if the baby does get choked on her spit-up. Wish we had known about this product when our other 8 great-grands where born. With 6 grands all in child producing age I'm sure we will be buying 5 more Owlet's.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bit pricey, but provides peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: I like it, gives great peace of mind. However, signal distance is short from base (~6ft) and the connection sound (which is super loud) keeps going off. Also, sensor a bit overly sensitive to "wiggling" and interference from something thick in the way, resulting in inability to get readings. Wish it didn't rely on wifi for use (e.g., travel to places without free or any wifi). Also, a bit pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Lu

customer_reviews.title: Great product. USE REGISTRY COMPLETION PERCENTAGE FOR A BETTER PRICE
customer_reviews.text: So far this is great. I used the registry competition percentage off for this. It disconnects from WiFi quite often and the sock turned off for a week once but customer service was great. They got it working again. The range is quite good on this. We live in a 5 bedroom, 2 story house and it still reads the sock on different floors and in different rooms than the base station. I worried about this.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Artiles

customer_reviews.title: App searching for base station....
customer_reviews.text: Was so excited for this purchase. The device is junk. The app on your phone works 25% of the time and you constantly get a message that the “app is searching for the base station”. I have reset the sensor and base numerous times. Seems ridiculous that a simple connection between two devices is so inconsistent.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Diemer

customer_reviews.title: It’s meh
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for our newborn son. The battery last throughout the night but make sure you charge it during the day or you won’t be using it the next night. At the beginning it would lose connection, then there was some time that the app didn’t work, and now it says he is wiggling where he is clearly sleeping. It’s great for peace of mind but not sure how realistic it is for it to work when it is actually needed.
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny for peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: Gives my family peace of mind when baby is sleeping and napping. We have a phobia of SIDS and have a habit of checking many times throughout the night if Baby is breathing. What adds to the risk is that Baby is a stomach sleeper which is not recommended because baby's face could be smothered by the mattress and suffocate. With the owlet on, we can rest assured knowing that if there is any abnormal heart beat or oxygen level, the alarm will sound. The foot strap is non-intrusive and comfortable yet snug enough so it doesn't fall off. Kind of pricey, but worth every penny for peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: bomb57

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Makes life easier with one less thing to worry about. This has aloud us to sleep when we can and be awake when we need to be. Our little baby has never been burned by it, never got a blister from it; essentially everything we read on the reviews that was bad... never happened. Don’t wrap it so tight, that could avoid the burns. Make sure the sock you are using is the right size, that will avoid blistering. We love it and will recommend it. I do wish it came with more than three features though. Come on owlet! Use those creative minds!
customer_reviews.author: Lokela

customer_reviews.title: Poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: Concept great, execution poor. The idea of having an app to monitor your baby is good but the app is been awful for months since June or so. Customer service will dodge questions and tell you to reinstall and delete the app for any issue. Would not buy again, way too expensive to work 25% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate. Unreliable.  Headache.
customer_reviews.text: Getting the thing set up with my note 10 was a nightmare, I ended up having to use my oldest sons phone to get the thing set up. The accuracy of the device itself is questionable to say the least. I also find it super annoying and unsettling that the notification parameters can not be changed as I would like to know BEFORE my newborns heart rate is below 60 and before her oxygen saturation is below 80%. Wishing there was a better alternative. Especially frustrating for the price. Not happy, will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny 8675309

customer_reviews.title: A must have for new parents
customer_reviews.text: This baby sock monitor is great. I use it on my granddaughter and it helps me stay stress-free during her naps and throughout the night. I like that it links right to your phone so that you don't have to use a separate monitor to track their heart rate and oxygen levels. I would recommend this to anyone who is expecting or currently has a newborn.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: best baby purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: The Owlet has been the best baby purchase for me by far! My baby had some minor breathing complications at birth and having the owlet on her when we got home helped alleviate my anxiety a lot. I can actually sleep now knowing my baby is safe and if something is wrong I will be alerted! I have been using it every night for almost 7 months without any false alarms. Owlet did replace the sensor when I was having issues with it after about 2 months of use and I haven't had an issues since. Definitely worth the splurge!
customer_reviews.author: CRL

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: The oxygen “Normal range” setting is not accurate. For my child she is supposed to stay above 92% oxygen, But this sock has a setting of 80%. So it will only alarm if the oxygen is 80% or lower. It would be nice if you can alter the alarm setting, such as set an alarm for a different oxygen level than what is pre-programmed. Overall it does give me peace of mind because I can still log into the app and check her oxygen level and heart rate manually, even if the alarm is not going off.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Wiggly baby
customer_reviews.text: This product has the right idea when it works. However, if your baby likes to sleep with movement such as a rock n play, swing, or vibration, then the owlet will not provide any readings. They claim it’s to provide the most accurate readings, but close enough would be better than not at all in my opinion. $300 for something that just tells me my baby is wiggling seems silly.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Every baby should have one!
customer_reviews.text: Every anxiety ridden new mom should have one of these! My baby was 6 weeks early. She was in the NICU for a month. She had a couple of episodes in the NICU where her HR or O2 would drop. The thought of coming home without all of the monitors to let me know she was okay was making me a nervous wreck. My husband ordered this and it was waiting for us when we got home. My baby wears this every night. We have had no issues with false alarms and it does not bother her at all when she is wearing it. Every baby should have one!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Burlison

customer_reviews.title: Too worried about the placement alarm going off
customer_reviews.text: I can only give 3 stars because I had some issues with it moving and the alarm waking me up. I need my sleep and the placement alarm is annoying. I get why it’s there but it added to my stress. I figured out how to place it so it wouldn’t move, but I guess knowing it could move and cause the alarm to go off is still there when I lay down at night. For this reason I don’t use it too often. I also wish I didn’t have to pay for a subscription to get historical data. It’s already expensive enough just to buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Nilikenoga

customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this product for almost a year and it’s been great. Seriously, if you can afford this, get it! I was nervous because some reviews said the placement alarm went off a lot, but that never happened to us thankfully. This allowed us to sleep well knowing our boy was safe in his crib. I will add that the sensor charging port seemed to be damaged and wasn’t charging correctly 11 months after purchase, and I called customer care. They were SO helpful and sent out a new one right away with a new charging cord and a new one year warranty! AMAZING! Thank you guys!
customer_reviews.author: Crystyn N.

customer_reviews.title: Owlet for the WIN!
customer_reviews.text: The Owlet was the first purchase we made for both our kids. We used the 1st gen with our daughter, and purchased the 2nd gen for our son. The peace of mind and ease of use are a game changer for us. My paramedic husband has had a couple SIDS related calls, and feels so at ease knowing we have an extra tool at our fingertips to help us protect our babies. Added bonus that the monitor goes on baby’s foot, so messes are avoided the majority of the time. Can’t say enough positive things about our Owlet. Amazing customer service, constant improvements to the app and service options.
customer_reviews.author: C. Burton

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS THING!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product so much. It has given me a piece of mind if anything which has in turned helped me sleep better at night. Also likes how it gives you graphs of your baby's sleep patterns and how long they slept that night. It's very accurate as far as that goes. I feel like the O2 sensor reads falsely lower at times considering every time he goes to the doctor he's 100%. This usually reads around 97% or so. It's a wonderful product!!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work correctly
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter was born on May 28th and I wanted to give this sock a fair try. So far it works some days and some days it does not. The app is slow and sometimes when I remove the sock The alarm doesn’t go off at all. I don’t feel like this product gives me peace of mind. It just gives me another thing to worry about.
customer_reviews.author: StinaFace

customer_reviews.title: The owlet has made monitoring my little ones vitals so easy and convenient!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy at first based on mixed reviews but I was using a huge pulse oximeter before and the owlet is definitely an upgrade! I wish the base didn’t need to be plugged in at all times, but I use a battery back to make this portable since my little one needs constant monitoring. I also wish the o2/heart rate alarm settings were adjustable, the battery life for the sensor was longer and wasn’t so sensitive, but overall satisfied! Hopefully they take these highly recommended ideas into account for the next launch.
customer_reviews.author: Mara

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of mind with new Infant
customer_reviews.text: Generally, the owlet has been an excellent piece of mind to have with our infant. It is small and easy to pack the base when traveling with the baby. The only complain we have is it is sometimes difficult to get it on a WiFi network when traveling new places with different internet speeds. You have to manage it through your computer and not the app, which can be inconvenient when traveling or the initial device set up. However, overall we have liked it and would recommend to friends/family
customer_reviews.author: Jordan W.

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife. It has been unreliable. The app often is not working. The base station supposedly dims, but our does not. It constantly pulses a bright green light that makes falling asleep unpleasant. Sometimes it won't connect. It works by sending your baby's data to a server, then back to your phone. They want specific information and pictures of your baby. If there were something better that doesn't do these things, I'd buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Chels

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Worth the money. My baby spent a month in the NICU and I knew I would go crazy not being able to see her vitals in numbers once we got home. Such a great way to have peace of mind. It is also super neat that my husband is able to check the app and get her vitals when out of town. Only downfall, the sock sizes don't come small enough for preemie babies which causes alarms of "lack of connection" often.
customer_reviews.author: Lacy H.

customer_reviews.title: Short Warranty, broke frequently.
customer_reviews.text: This item broke three times, twice covered under warranty. The warranty doesn’t even last as long as your child should wear the sock, and ours broke beyond repair immediately after the warranty term. Very expensive item to have so poorly supported.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa Frey

customer_reviews.title: CHECK WITH YOUR PHYSICIAN BEFORE ORDERING - THEY HIGHLY ADVISE AGAINST THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Not only does your physician likely advise against this, it can cause false alarms and thousands in medical bills. Your natural parental instincts will not let you leave the baby alone. Breathing and skin color are the true indications of your baby's health.
customer_reviews.author: solomon a.

customer_reviews.title: Too many notifications :(
customer_reviews.text: We are having major trouble getting our Owlet to stop notifying us about a poor connection. We have tried literally EVERYTHING. I tried moving the base closer to where he sleeps, switching size socks, putting a regular sock over the owlet sock to keep it from moving, switched feet, called customer service and they tried updating it from their end... nothing has worked. Very disappointed. I’ve had several friends rave about this product which is why we purchased, but for some reason it doesn’t work for us.
customer_reviews.author: aimsnicole

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am beyond frustrated with this product. When we first got it, we had multiple false alarms of my baby’s oxygen being too low (under 80% saturation)- I took her to the doctor worried and the doctor’s measurement of her o2 was 98%. We thought maybe we just needed to let her foot get a little bigger and we can try again. I still sometimes try and the oxygen still measures low. I now can’t even use it because I got new internet and it will not let me change my wifi no matter what I try. Soo disappointed I wasted so much money.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Really provides me with peace of mind. Aside from the oxygen and HR monitoring, what I really love is the report on sleep quality. We started sleeping training our son at 8 weeks and we could really tell how much better he's sleeping by comparing the graphs before and after. There are only 2 downsides to the Owlet, 1) poor battery life, needs to be charged everyday, and 2) for red alerts to alarm you on your phone, the ringer has to be on. My phone was on vibrate one time so the alert only shows up on the phone without making a noise.
customer_reviews.author: mc_SSTJ

customer_reviews.title: Worth. Every. Penny.
customer_reviews.text: Worth every single penny to be able to have the reassurance that my baby is ok. It gives us peace of mind when going to bed knowing it will go off if something is wrong. My son was in the NICU for 2 months so this helped us mentally. The week we came home, he stopped breathing and the monitor went off. If it wasn’t for the monitor going off, we would’ve never known. So thankful for the monitor. The battery life is great, we us it all night and we charge it during the day. You will not regret buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: Katlyn

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind for this mama
customer_reviews.text: I can't talk enough about how wonderful this product is. I had wanted one since I first got pregnant, but was hesitant because of the price. I ended up caving because of a SIDS scare a few weeks ago. Since then I've used it every night and it allows all of us to get better sleep since I'm not checking on the baby every five minutes. I love the simple, user friendly app and live readings aspect. It was a little difficult to get set up but that was because of my Wi-Fi, not the device itself.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Best thing ever
customer_reviews.text: I love this little thing!! My first baby was a preemie who came home with a monitor. That monitor gave me so much peace of mind and let me actually *sleep*, instead of checking on him every few minutes. My second baby was full term, and I was constantly worried that something would happen while sleeping. So when the third baby came along, I knew I needed this little sock. It's super easy to use and put on, and that soft, glowing green light tells me I can sleep, knowing he's being monitored.
customer_reviews.author: C. Kemp

customer_reviews.title: DOESN'T WORK. DONT WASTE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Don't know if it is worth it not. Because it just couldn't connect to home wifi. Tried all we could. Even tried contacting support but they never were available. We bought it before baby was born, so by the time we were ready to use it, it didn't work and we can't even return it! BEWARE GUYS, this might be a good product, but you WILL have issues just installing/connecting it.
customer_reviews.author: Yogeshwar Sharma

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: Overall this product has given us serious peace of mind. I do wish the battery life was better because if you forget to charge it you're out of luck - won't make it through a 2nd night. Sock placement can be tricky so that took some practice. It also definitely works better on one foot than the other. There were a few scary "sock placement alarms" when we first used it before we really understood the different tones and color warnings.
customer_reviews.author: Caleh100

customer_reviews.title: Great when it’s working
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved our owlet! My daughter has seizures and it added peace of mind when she was sleeping. It actually alerted me when she had one because her oxygen always drops very low during a seizure. Only reason I gave it a 3 is because in the last month it’s been acting glitchy. Not charging, and now it’s completely dead and won’t turn on or charge. So I’m trying to decide to make another purchase because it was so so amazing - just didn’t last long.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this is the best product a mother could ask for
customer_reviews.text: Oh My JESUS, this is the best product a mother could ask for. My Grand Daughter stopped breathing a week after she was born. We didn't have this product, but luckily she was in the arms of my daughter in law. No, she doesn't go to sleep without it. She had to have something to be able to sleep as well, without this, she said she wouldn't be able to sleep, now she rest with ease. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Bobbitt

customer_reviews.title: A newborn must have
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can sleep in confidence, knowing I’ll be alerted if my baby needs help. In the first week the 02 monitor went of twice, letting me know that my baby wasn’t getting the oxygen she needed. I was able to adjust her in her bassinet, watch her levels rise, then go back to sleep without worrying. I love that it tracks her sleep patterns. It’s definitely the best sleep I’ve ever had with a newborn in the house.
customer_reviews.author: DavidHuff

customer_reviews.title: Owlet Smart Sock 2 is a great product
customer_reviews.text: It gives new parents a peace of mind. We had to figure out to put it on correctly after the alarm for not correct fit went on so often but afterwards it’s just great. The only thing I do not like as much is that it needs a bit to long to connect to the phone to get the babies reading.
customer_reviews.author: Simone Leffler

customer_reviews.title: Better battery life needed
customer_reviews.text: Great peace of mind for new parents. We used the sock every night for the first several weeks but after that we don’t use it as often. It is good for what it does and I only recommend it for people who think they will stress out about their baby sleeping. The battery life of horrible. You barely get an entire night from one charge. It would be nice to get at least 24 hours because your baby sleeps all day and night so you basically have to go several hours without the sock so it can charge.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The base stopped working and it was replaced by the manufacturer and the customer service has been good. It was disappointing that the item caused the ...
customer_reviews.text: We honestly didn't use this much. It rubbed a sore on my baby's foot despite talking with the manufacturer about fit. The base stopped working and it was replaced by the manufacturer and the customer service has been good. It was disappointing that the item caused the sore and that is what forced us to stop using it.
customer_reviews.author: KS Medic

customer_reviews.title: Noticed red blotches on feet at 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I liked that I was able to use my phone to check in without going into babies room. We never had any false alarms. However at 5 months, using the largest sock I noticed red blotches on feet and the sock felt and smelled warm. I have reached out to the seller and have not heard anything back. I have stopped using it. With this price tag on it..I expected to use it until it no longer fit or for first year.
customer_reviews.author: Donna O

customer_reviews.title: Owlet is very dependable
customer_reviews.text: My daughter had twins so I bought her the Owlet for piece of mind when the babies finally came home from the hospital after 83 days. Some had said that there are a lot of false alarms. I have not found this to be true, as long as you have the monitor placed correctly on the babies foot. We love the Owlet and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Vital purchase for a parent. Don’t buy anything for a baby before you buy this.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! It’s like having a guardian angel watching over her during the night shift so we can get our rest. It dims perfectly for night time and the battery last all the time she’s sleeping. Wish it held a charge for 2 days but I don’t mind charging it everyday in exchange for the peace of mind that helps us sleep confidently she’s sleeping safely.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: For the most part, it is a good system. But it CAN be quirky.
customer_reviews.text: The battery life for the sock could be much improved. For the most part, the unit works properly but it can be very quirky at times and have false alarms. Having the sock fit properly on the baby’s foot is VITAL. The app for the most part is easy to use, just the sock isn’t with how you must strap it. The brightness of the base station is almost too bright at night. We keep it on the dim setting all the time.
customer_reviews.author: andreww88

customer_reviews.title: This sock is awesome to monitor your sweet baby while they sleep
customer_reviews.text: This sock is awesome to monitor your sweet baby while they sleep! But before buying, know that it only works when your baby is completely still. My daughter doesn’t like socks and tries to kick it off so we are unable to use at the moment. We are hoping to be able to use when she gets a little older. One other issue that we had is that the sick would come off partially and alarm in the middle of the night. The sock was on correctly before.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind during baby’s sleep.
customer_reviews.text: I can sleep so much better knowing that my baby is being constantly monitored by the owlet. This little gadget gives me peace of mind at night with my 3 month old baby, and he has been wearing the monitor since his first week. He was 3 weeks premature, and there is no way I would have been able to sleep those first days without the owlet. Easy to use and my baby doesn’t mind wearing it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Liliana Andrade

customer_reviews.title: Great peace of mind!!!
customer_reviews.text: This gives such peace of mind. With a new born with acid reflux and not sleeping well, this product gave me the peace to sleep and still know my baby is okay. With a new born, especially your first baby, there can be many natural worries. This product helps relieve those worries. I would recommend this product to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Curtis B. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great product but most people dont need it!
customer_reviews.text: Great item but I can tell you this, Save your money if you dont have a medical reason and/or knowledge on what bp &o2 levels mean. Most people only use this for a few weeks and then get tired of charging the batteries daily or the false alarms waking everyone up at night. But you can change the alarm settings to not go off but then whats the point of the item?
customer_reviews.author: Romeo011179

customer_reviews.title: Clear visual works great remotely
customer_reviews.text: Love my owlet cam. I love being able to see my LO remotely when we have a sitter. The app loads up quickly and is clear as day. We use an iPad at home so it doesn’t drain our phone batteries and also love seeing our LO on such a big screen. Our only issue is with our bad internet (which isn’t owlets fault obviously) but it does rely on it so there has been a couple of times we had trouble. Also not sure the temp gage is accurate, not an issue for us personally, but if you lived somewhere where you had temp concerns this might not be a reliable source. Overall I would highly recommend this cam.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing! We switched our little guy to his crib for all naps, which puts his on the upstairs level when he's asleep and the rest of us are on the floor below. I love love love knowing that all is okay and being able to check on him with the click of a button while he's up there asleep.
customer_reviews.author: A. Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product works well with the exception of delayed alarm to cell phone when away from home while baby is home.This could be due to our cell service,so I cannot say it’s the sock itself. At home it’s 100%.We love the sense of security at home .Well worth every penny.Great gift idea as well
customer_reviews.author: Traci  T

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: I love this sock. I am a paranoid mom, and this sock helps ease my fears when I wake up in the middle of the night worried about my baby girl. My only complaint is that the connected care app is only available on itunes, and we are an android family. You can still use the owelet app, which is great for real time readings. I recently spent two nights away from home, and the app was a great way to check and make sure she was still doing ok =)
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 10 months...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this sock during a black Friday deal and stored it untill baby was born (a few months later). We got great use out of the product for a solid 10 months. At the 10 month mark the product stopped charging and holding a charge. We would wake up to alarms from sock in middle of night due to low battery alerts... We kept troubleshooting ourselves trying to resolve the issue, but we failed. We contacted customer service and they said since we were just outside the warranty they couldn't offer a replacement. Instead, they suggested we buy a new sensor from them. Not happy with the short lifespan of the product and customer service trying to upsell us...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save your money!
customer_reviews.text: Save your money! I have already had to get a new one cause my first one stopped working a week into using it. Now my other is not working and it will be almost a week until a new one is here. Hard to get peace of mind when the product doesn’t work!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work
customer_reviews.text: We put it on her foot and it says wiggling and wont read no matter what we do. Contacted customer service twice and no response. Very frustrating for 300$. Would def go a different direction.
customer_reviews.author: rhe white

customer_reviews.title: Terrible range
customer_reviews.text: Sock has to be within 6 feet of the base station or the alarm goes off. It doesn't go off right away but usually around 330 am. Even if it is close it still goes off. Owlet support basically tells you to move them closer together.....thanks for the tip. Also if you need to change WiFi networks good luck. Hopefully you don't have an Android. That said When it does work it's great
customer_reviews.author: Coach

customer_reviews.title: YES, BUY IT.
customer_reviews.text: BEST THING EVER! Having a baby is scary enough, add in the constant worry and sleep deprivation and it’s a recipe for disaster. As first time parents we got this sock with the hopes of a little extra peace of mind and boy does it work. Easy to use and you know it works because if your baby kicks it off or it’s misplaced during the night an alarm goes off. I couldn’t sleep without it. BEST THING INVENTED.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE HIGH SPEED WIFI
customer_reviews.text: This thing is trash. A $300 paperweight. If you do not have high speed WiFi. You can’t use it. Meaning you can’t use it in the car, Park, school, supermarket, bank, friends or family house. There is no point of having this. If you can only use it at home.
customer_reviews.author: Deus Human

product_meta.title: Owlet Smart Sock 2 Baby Monitor, Green
feature_bullets: Know your baby is okay: Track your baby's heart rate and oxygen levels while they sleep using clinically-proven pulse oximetry, and be notified if something appears to be wrong. Have complete peace of mind knowing you can keep track of your baby's heart rate and oxygen levels from anywhere.

Worry less and sleep better: The Smart Sock connects to a base station that glows green letting you know everything is okay, but uses lights, sounds and app notifications if heart rate or oxygen levels are too high or too low. Parents can sleep better and have less anxiety knowing they'll be made aware if levels go outside of preset zones.

Convenient, easy-to-use: Each unit includes 3 washable socks that comfortably wrap around the baby's foot and connect to a base station up to 100 ft. away without wires. Socks fit most infants from 0-18 months or 6-25 pounds and should be hand washed regularly and alternated from right to left foot each night. Always keep the base station at least three feet away from your baby's crib.

Smart phone app: See real-time heart rate and oxygen levels on multiple phones using Owlet's cloud-connected app. Free iOS & Android apps available. New history tab provides parents with historical trends for heart rate and oxygen and sleep tracking--see how long & how well baby slept.
Our promise: Love it or return within 30 days for a full refund, making it a great gift for baby registries and showers or as a gift to new parents. BPA free, latex free, lead free.

specifications.Safety warning: The Smart Sock is an information-gathering product intended to assist in tracking the well-being of healthy babies from 6 to 25 pounds and up to 18 months of age. It is not a medical monitor or other medical device and is not intended to diagnose, cure, treat, alleviate or prevent any disease or health condition or investigate, replace or modify anatomy or any physiological process. You should always follow pediatrician-recommended safe sleep practices when using the Smart Sock.
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars3,187 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
